text:
Bernard Debré (30 September 1944 – 13 September 2020) was a French urologist and politician. He was a member ("député") of the National Assembly of France from 2012 to 2017. He was one of the representatives of the city of Paris. He was a member of the Union for a Popular Movement. From 1992 to 2001, he was the Mayor of Amboise.
Debré was born in Toulouse, France. He was the son of Prime Minister Michel Debré and twin-brother of Jean-Louis Debré.
Debré died on 13 September 2020 of cancer at the age of 75. His brother, François Debré died the next day.
